definition: to spit/to send out (silk from a silkworm, bolls from cotton flowers etc)/to say/to pour out (one's grievances)
dew/syrup/nectar/outdoors (not under cover)/to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose

sentences.english: He could not but cough up his political scandal.
sentences.chinese: 他迫不得已只好吐露出他的政治醜聞。

sentences.english: Let us smell the fragrance of Tuberose reveal?
sentences.chinese: 讓我們嗅到了夜來香吐露的芬芳？

sentences.english: She had known nothing of the plan. Diego had never let on.
sentences.chinese: 她對這個計劃一無所知，迭戈從未吐露隻言片語。

sentences.english: Vow to be a flower bearing fragrance.
sentences.chinese: 發願作一朵鮮花，吐露芬芳，給人清香。

sentences.english: The sunshine greets me with a smile. The rain, his sad sister, talks my heart.
sentences.chinese: 陽關微笑着問候我，雨，他憂鬱的妹妹向我吐露心聲。

sentences.english: If life lasted but a day I would emit all my fragrance.
sentences.chinese: 如果生命只有短暫的一晝夜，我要盡情吐露芬芳。

sentences.english: I don't go for one thing, " he confides."
sentences.chinese: 我不會在一件事上吊着，”他吐露道。

sentences.english: I want to feel your love, will you reveal your love?
sentences.chinese: 我想要感受你的愛你會吐露真情嗎？

sentences.english: I poured out my complaint before him; I shewed before him my trouble.
sentences.chinese: 我在他面前吐露我的苦情，陳說我的患難。

sentences.english: She ‘s tight-mouthed .So far she has not breathed a word about that.
sentences.chinese: 她的嘴很緊，直到現在對那件事她也沒有吐露一個字。

sentences.english: This business is hush-hush. Never breathe a word to anyone about it.
sentences.chinese: 這件事可不要聲張，千萬別向任何人吐露一個字。

sentences.english: Such as sword, for the first time speak out.
sentences.chinese: 蘭如劍第一次吐露心聲。

sentences.english: I dared not voice my dissatisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 我不敢吐露出我的不滿。

sentences.english: I was surprised that he gave his real name to a stranger.
sentences.chinese: 他向陌生人吐露真名實姓，使我感到很喫驚。

sentences.english: He is very much a private man and confides in no one.
sentences.chinese: 他是個很隱祕的人，從不向人吐露他的祕密。

sentences.english: Kindness and understanding will often draw a boy unburden his conscience .
sentences.chinese: 仁愛和理解常會使得男孩吐露真情，解除良心的負擔。

definition: to pour out (emotions)/to unburden oneself (of strong feelings)/to vomit comprehensively
to recount/to tell of/to relate/(fig.) (of a thing) to stand as testament to (some past history)
lit. to put everything out including the tray/to reveal everything/to make a clean breast of it all
to recount/to narrate/to give an account of
to say everything (that is on one's mind)
to try to cover up/hiding place
(to express one's) true feelings/what is on one's mind/secret mind
to reveal (indirectly, implicitly)/to show (interest, contempt etc) by means of one's actions, tone of voice etc
